titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:17-0400

did.abstract: Linguistic field recordings in the Pima Bajo language, primarily elicitations conducted in Spanish. Recorded in Yecora, Sonora, Mexico, in the summer of 1965.
did.physdesc: 12 sound tape reels (23 hr., 14 min.) : analog, 3 3/4 ips, 2 track, mono ; 5 in.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Project report on fieldwork in the Highland dialect with very brief discussion concerning phonology and syntax available in the Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented by Timothy Dunnigan in 1965. This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Words, phrases, and sentences elicited in Spanish, given in Pima Bajo. Recorded at Yecora, Sonora, Mexico.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.
